q: What documents are needed for road transport in India?
a: Typically LR (Lorry Receipt/Bilty), eWay bill if goods value/exemption rules apply, invoice/challan, and ID of consignor/consignee. Our team helps generate LR and guide on eWay bill thresholds.

q: How is road freight pricing calculated?
a: Pricing depends on distance, diesel price, tolls, load weight/volume, truck type, and lane demand. We estimate fuel using average km/l and add tolls and operating costs, then apply a margin.

q: What truck capacity should I choose?
a: Common options: 14–20T rigid trucks, 25–30T multi-axle, and 32–35T trailers. For fragile/volumetric goods, use volumetric weight. Share load (tons) and dimensions for the best match.

q: Do you offer part truck load (PTL) and full truck load (FTL)?
a: Yes, we support both FTL (dedicated vehicle) and PTL (shared capacity). FTL is faster and direct; PTL optimizes cost for smaller consignments with hub-and-spoke routes.

q: How do I place a booking?
a: Use the Booking portal to enter customer name, pickup, dropoff, and load (tons). Review the AI quote and submit. Our ops team assigns a driver and vehicle.
